alert.note: Alert for Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Suffolk; Western Norfolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 1:51PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORM NEAR THE SOUTH SHORE... At 151 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Quincy, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Locations impacted include... Boston, Quincy, Weymouth, Braintree, Randolph, Milton, Hingham, Scituate, Holbrook, Norwell, Hull and Cohasset. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for eastern and southeastern Massachusetts.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Suffolk; Western Norfolk
